title.narrative: River Waste collection and Processing Can Tho Vietnam

description.narrative: Vietnam is one of the world’s most vulnerable countries to climate change, with adaptation challenges accordingly severe, especially in the Mekong Delta. Despite of a relatively high rate of (informal) solid urban waste recycling, the current economy leads to the depletion of precious resources and does not account for negative externalities exerted upon the environment. A circular economy presents a sustainable solution to part of the socio-economic and environmental challenges resulting from the current linear economic model in Vietnam. Moreover, Organizations like the governmental Central Institute for Economic Management (CIEM and the Vietnam Chamber of Commerce and Industry (VCCI) are interested in the potential of circular economy strategies.In January 2019, an Memorandum of Understanding on River Plastic Interception in the Mekong Delta Pilot Project was signed between The Ocean Cleanup (TOC), Can Tho City Department of Natural Resources (Can Tho DONRE), Can Tho City Resilience City Office (CRO), College of Environment and Natural Resources of Can Tho University (CTU).This project will result in a local in-depth study giving a clear overview of the type of waste being collected, the pathways to process the collected waste, to boost local knowledge on waste technologies, to mobilize capital and to bring Vietnamese and Dutch private sector together to take up the challenges. The project is one of the activities of the Embassy under their Multi-Annual Strategy regarding Circular Economy.
